p: The extracts of different parts inhibited the pain induced by formaldehyde in the paws of mice. In the first phase (0–5 min), the inhibition ranged from 67% to 94%. However, in the second phase (15–30 min), the inhibitory effect of extracts varied from 76 to 91% compared to the control group. Diclofenac and plant extracts showed similar effects of pain inhibition in the two phases.
